meanings.definition: An action or event serving as an introduction or preliminary to something else.
meanings.sent1: The prelusion to the magic show was a short video introducing the magician.
meanings.sent2: The prelusion to the concert was the dimming of the lights and the hush of the audience.
meanings.sent3: The prelusion to the party was the sound of balloons popping in the distance.
meanings.sent4: The prelusion to success is often hard work and dedication.
meanings.sent5: The prelusion to the storm was the distant rumble of thunder.

meanings.definition: A hint or indication of something to come.
meanings.sent1: Her smile was a prelusion of the good news she was about to share.
meanings.sent2: The dark clouds were a prelusion of the impending rainstorm.
meanings.sent3: The sudden drop in temperature was a prelusion of the approaching winter.
meanings.sent4: The first few raindrops were a prelusion to the heavy downpour that followed.
meanings.sent5: The distant sound of bells was a prelusion to the arrival of the parade.
